sen.j: 乞食の老女が卒塔婆に腰掛けているのを、高野山の僧が見咎め、説教を始めるが、逆に法論でやり込められる。
sen.e: Having found an old woman sitting on a Sotoba (a curved Buddhist statue), a monk of Mt. Koya admonished her and started to give her a lecture; but, on the contrary, the woman talked him down by her argument.
sen.cmt: ※原文では「卒塔婆に腰掛けている」とだけの記載で腰をかけている状況が曖昧でわかりにくいです。具体的には「卒塔婆が朽ちた木」に腰掛けているため "a tumble-down Sotoba"などとしたほうがよいと思われます。 （http://www.kanshou.com/01/sotoba.htm）
sen.e: Having found an old beggar woman sitting on a Sotoba (a curved Buddhist statue), a monk of Mt. Koya admonished her and started to give her a lecture; but, on the contrary, the woman quelched him with her argument.
